features: Nest Cam has built-in intelligence and can tell the difference between a person, animal, and vehicle and send alerts directly through the Google Home app[1], no subscription required.Controller Type:Google Assistant.Connectivity protocol:Bluetooth;Wi-Fi.Power source type:Battery Powered.Operating Temperature : –4°F to 104°F (–20°C to 40°C).

Easily check in from anywhere 24/7 with 1080p HDR video[1] with night vision, and see what you missed with 3 hours of free event video history[2]; add a Nest Aware subscription (sold separately) for up to 60 days of video history[3]

If your Wi-Fi goes down or there’s a power outage, Nest Cam will store up to an hour of recorded events so you can see what you missed[4]. Nest Cam Outdoor comes with a wall plate that can be mounted on your brick wall.
Put Nest Cam anywhere, outside or in; it’s battery powered, so you don’t need to set it up near an outlet, and the magnetic mount makes installation effortless
For continuous power and 24/7 video recording with Nest Aware Plus, add a weatherproof power cable or indoor stand with power cable (both sold separately)
Stream your live video feed hands-free on compatible smart displays with Google Assistant, and compatible smart displays, smart TVs, and tablets with Amazon Alexa
Nest Cam requires the Google Home app and a free Google Account; it’s not compatible with the Nest app or the Nest site
Set up Activity Zones to receive phone notifications about specific areas of your home and know when familiar faces arrive[1,5]

Take action in an instant if something happens; talk and listen with the built-in speaker and mic on your security camera or call your local emergency service directly from the Google Home app (Nest Aware subscription required)[6]

Please refer to the product description section below for all applicable legal disclaimers denoted by the bracketed numbers in the preceding bullet points (e.g., [1], [2], etc.). Up to 6.10 m (20 ft) illumination. 6 high-power 850 nm infrared LEDs
body.description: The Nest Cam security camera is wire-free and weather resistant, so it goes almost anywhere you need it, outside or in. Know when something important happens at home with intelligent alerts and take action right from the Google Home app.[1] Because it’s a wireless security camera, it’s easy to install yourself – no outlet required. View live HD video, replay video recordings, talk to visitors, and more – all from the Google Home app. This home security camera requires a free Google Account and is not compatible with the Nest app. [1]Some features, including mobile notifications, remote control, video streaming, and video recording, require working internet and Wi-Fi. [2]Up to 3 hours recording. Learn more at g.co/nest/3hours. [3]Nest Aware and Nest Aware Plus subscription sold separately. [4]Learn more at g.co/nest/cam-mem.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Built-in intelligence for better detection. The Nest Cam security camera knows the difference between people, animals, and vehicles and sends alerts for important activity.[1] You can choose which alerts you get, right in the Google Home app.

Outdoors or indoors. Battery or wired. Nest Cam is battery powered and weather resistant, so it’s designed to go almost anywhere you need it. For continuous power and 24/7 video recording with Nest Aware Plus[3,] add a weatherproof cable or indoor stand (both sold separately).[8]

Previous page Know what’s happening 24/7. Or go back in time. Check in with 1080p HDR video or see what happened with 3 hours of free event video history.[1,2] Talk to who’s there, even when you’re not. Easily interact with delivery persons or other visitors with the built-in speaker and mic.[1] Snap it into place. Almost any place. Installation is easy with the magnetic mount. Just place your Nest Cam and adjust to your liking. A clear view, day or night. See what’s happening 24/7 in 1080p HDR video.[1] Night vision helps you see in low light. Stream your video hands-free. Speak up to see the live feed on smart displays or TVs that have Google Assistant or Alexa.[7] Next page 1 Check in on your home 2 Talk and listen 3 Easy installation 4 HDR and night vision 5 Voice control

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Nest Cam Faults
reviews.reviewText: I have installed 8 of these devices, of the 8, 3 have failed within a month due to the charging connector being corroded on both the socket and the magnetic end.I have been looking for some product to help like Corrosion X or similar but have not heard from Google on something to help with the build quality.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Great night vision / motion detection and picture quality. Easy to install / durable / pure quality product. Highly recommend! 5 Stars

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars High Quality Picture and Good Battery Life
reviews.reviewText: I'm a tech nerd and have tried various brands which have worked ok. I wanted to try the Google Wireless camera's just to see if they lived up to the hype. I am very happy with them. The motion detection is great, the picture quality is great, and with the very active neighborhood that we live in, the battery life is great. As they're magnetically attached, very easy to remove and charge which doesn't take too much time. The Google Home app has improved and overall I'm very happy with the camera's. Of the many name brands that I've tried (wired and wireless) these are the best I've had.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Things To Know
reviews.reviewText: I’ve only had this camera for a month or so but wanted to share a few things you should know.1. I have 6 or the generation 1 outdoor nest cameras. I like them but this is a good and comparable replacement. It was easy to install and it works well.2. Lake many of the many, if not all, new Google Nest products, this camera does not work with the Nest App. You now have to use the Google Home app. I suspect eventually, everyone will put pushed to use that app, even people using the older Nest products.3. This camera does not come with a cable that allows you to plug in. Instead, you can use the internal battery, which realistically, needs to be recharged every month or so (not the advertised 3 months). You can also buy a third party solar panel which keeps that battery charged at around 70%. As another option, you can purchase a cable which allows you to plug it in. Why would you want to do that, you ask. Because running on the battery and/or solar does not do continuous recording like the gen 1 camera did. The only way to get continuous recording would be to plug it in.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 16, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars DON'T BUY! BEWARE!
reviews.reviewText: Please DO NOT waste you time with this. You will NEVER get support when the cameras malfunction.I purchased these July 12, 2023. When I got the two cameras and the doorbell, I charged them and waited until July 15th for my son to come help me mount them outside in my yard. Everything seemed fine. Then it was time to charge them. I could get a step stool and reach the cameras, so I brought them inside. This was August 13th, around 4 weeks of use. I have them under the roof edge, protected from the sun and rain. For days now, I have attempted everything to charge them. NOTHING WORKS. Here are my main issues.First, I want to address my experience with Amazon customer service. The first person stated they would issue a return and I could exchange them. Great, just what I wanted. I felt maybe I got a bad batch of cameras. As she was starting the process, I was stating that I looked online for help. I seen a few forums talking about the issue but nothing resolved. She then asked if I would be willing to talk to Amazon technical support. Sure, I can do that. Maybe they have some experience with this issue.Talked with the next person, he runs through everything about what I have tried. I explain it says "offline" and even on the charger, it is not registering on my Google Home app. When charging my doorbell, it shows it as charging and how long until charged. Not with the cameras. I even removed them from my home network, did a factory reset, and still they show up as 5 days of charge left and will not register as charging. At this point he says, "Let me call this number for Google and see if I can get someone on the phone to help us and I can see if I can get you transferred to them". Great! Maybe they have an easy fix so I don't have to send them back. A few minutes later, he gives an update about still being on hold. He does this a few times. Great communication, I loved him checking in with me. Another 10 minutes goes by and he gets back on the phone. Now I already told him, I used Google to find a customer support or technical support number for Nest products and Google couldn't tell me.You are not going to believe what GOOGLE told him. So he tells me that Google would not allow him to transfer or connect me on the call. I had to personally reach out to connect with them. This technical person said they would not be able to give any guidance to him, or offer suggestions to try and fix this. WOW! SO he said they gave him a way for me to connect with them. ( support dot google dot com backslash googlenest ) YOU GOT TO BE KIDDING ME. I explained to the Amazon Support person that I have spent 2 days on this same website and can't connect to anyone. You answer the questions and it takes you to a forum and question section where someone with the same question has been getting feedback about. Let me tell you this: If you have issues like me where your camera is offline and won't connect to your home network, or you can't get it to charge, you won't find anything here. There is literally no connection to this in the options given. Now you can search on Google and it will take you to a few places, but it won't directly offer you this as an issue to attempt to resolve.So the Amazon Support person said he would transfer me back so I can get an exchange or a refund if I wanted it. Now another person takes my call. She reviews what is going on and asks me "What do you want now?" Um, an exchange on the product. She says she can't process an exchange or refund. My window of opportunity ended yesterday. No it did not. I watched it on my end and it says August 16th and that is today. I tried for days to try and get this figured out. I need to send this back so you can send me out a replacement. Again she says no. So I walked through the process on my computer while speaking to her. I then said, should I hit the submit button and take it to my local Kohl's? I want to exchange, not refund. She puts me on hold and comes back to say she can't exchange, just refund. She was able to find another way around it in the system. REALLY?So in the end, I am getting a refund that will take 2-3 weeks. Normally it goes onto my Amazon balance and I can order it again right away. Not this time! It goes to my credit card, who is not going to process that refund right away and sit on it for awhile. I asked why it can't be issued as a credit on my Amazon account and was not given a "solid" reason. So I hung up and called back. Next person explains "Due to the high value item, it goes back to the original payment method. We do not offer exchanges with high value items". Interesting.Now I know where I will not be buying any "high value" electronics from. I will find them locally and purchase in the store. This is highly unacceptable customer service. Now I will not be able to have cameras on my home until Thanksgiving break because I won't have anyone around me to install them. Everyone is leaving for school soon. I can't climb a ladder and use a drill or power tool to install them.As for the products, my doorbell is great. The cameras were nothing fancy and didn't really help me see people clearly. I wanted to have more than 30 seconds recording when someone was in my yard. It defaults back to 30 seconds and the settings show you can have it for 2 or 3 minutes. I also did that subscription thing, which I think is probably a waste of money. After a few weeks being installed, I constantly had my cameras show offline, then they would show online after a few hours. Not worth the price of these things. My neighbor has different cameras, so maybe I will just look for something else when I finally get a refund.Amazon, you really need to consider your return policy. I can send back $7 glasses and get an exchange right away. Even weeks later. But have an issue with a "high value" item and you are treated like someone who cried wolf.Google, you really need to have a way for someone to contact you.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great cameras, but pricey and shorter battery life
reviews.reviewText: These cameras are very nice and the build quality seems superior, however, I’ve used several other brands for home monitoring and they all had similar performance at much better prices. I chose these ultimately because I wanted to pair them with my other Nest indoor cameras and have a seem-less integration within google home.The battery power seems slightly less efficient than other brands I’ve used (blink) and the accessory cables are outrageously priced if you do want to go the wired route. I bought the 2 camera pack and they only provided 1 charging cable. You think they could have included one cable per camera so you can charge them both at the same time. Not a deal breaker, but seems like a odd place for google to skimp. Just another way to charge customers more for accessories. If the single camera box comes with a cable, the 2 camera box should come with two.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I had been wanting these for a while but never pulled the trigger. We had the doorbell camera and thought that was enough. Then a man walked into our backyard and rummaged through my husband’s car! Our neighborhood is very safe so I was shocked! I took the footage to the police but because we only had one camera we were not able to identify him. The next day I bought these. We had someone come and install the mounts because our house is brick. But the tech side of the set up was a breeze! Took me 5 seconds to pair with my google home. I changed my settings to only turn the camera on when there is a person present to save battery life. They work great. I get notifications every time the mailman comes or my family arrives home. The night vision is also great! Haven’t had to charge them for about a month now either!

I like the quality of the video and how quickly the cameras turn on live mode when requested. What could be improved is the technical ability to change your cameras between Wi-Fi servers without the need to remove the camera factory reset it and then reinstall it
Cumplen 100% las expectativas, tienen un excelente ángulo de visión, son muy certeras al mandar notificaciones.

Works amazingly, if you have good wifi and a strong connection.The only reason it doesn't get a 5 star and only a 4 is because Google removed the feature that allowed you to view your camera on your TV. I can always cast it from my phone but then I can't use my phone, kinda silly but still all around good product.
